name: AdditionalData
description: The AdditionalData class serves as an extension mechanism for information not otherwise represented in the data model.  For relatively simple information, atomic data types (e.g., integers, strings) are provided with a mechanism to annotate their meaning. The class can also be used to extend the data model (and the associated Schema) to support proprietary extensions by encapsulating entire XML documents conforming to another Schema (e.g., IDMEF).  A detailed discussion for extending the data model and the schema can be found in Section 5.

type.name: type
type.description: The data type of the element content.  The permitted values for this attribute are shown below.  The default value is "string".

values.description: The element content is of type BOOLEAN.
The element content is of type BYTE.
The element content is of type CHARACTER.
The element content is of type DATETIME.
The element content is of type INTEGER.
The element content is of type PORTLIST.
The element content is of type REAL.
The element content is of type STRING.
The element content is XML (see Section 5).

ext-dtype.name: ext-dtype
ext-dtype.description: A means by which to extend the dtype attribute.  See Section 5.1.

meaning.name: meaning
meaning.description: A free-form description of the element content.

formatid.name: formatid
formatid.description: An identifier referencing the format and semantics of the element content.

restriction.name: restriction
restriction.description: This attribute has been defined in Section 3.2.

data.name: data
data.description: This attribute has been defined in Section 3.2.
